page.title: 02Population
page.content: The area covered by this part of the Survey is part of what is sometimes called the Solway Plane. The land is very flat and fertile, and its main use is given over to farming. There are no large centres of population rather a number a small hamlets (less than 20 homes in each). There is no centre of population to which people can gather so the school is the focus for all activities, this itself is isolated, the only other building nearby being the Parish Church. There is very little new building in the area, due mainly to the fact that there is no public sewage system and therefore people have to rely on septic tanks. There is, therefore no growth in the population of this area.
